text:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
Give feedback to the Helper's last response.

### Input:
Seeker: Hi..how are you today. Iam looking for some help towards facing breakup with the partner. can you help me providing some emotional support. Is there anything that I can do to be get out of the sadness in my life
Helper: Absolutely. Tell me more about it. When did it happen?
Seeker: it happened about a week ago..my boyfriend is being very possessive about everything I do. I find it not convincing and broke up with him
Helper: I see. Were you living with your boyfriend? How was your life post breakup?

### Response:{"perfect": true, "goodareas": ["Questions"]}

Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
Give feedback to the Helper's last response.

### Input:
Helper: Hi how are you?
Seeker: Hello. I am depressed
Helper: I'm sorry you are depressed. What's going on?

### Response:{"perfect": false, "goodareas": ["Empathy"], "feedback": "The goal is to offer support and empathy for the seeker. While the response is fine, it could be improved by asking a more professional question that is less vague.", "badareas": ["Questions", "Professionalism"], "alternative": "I'm really sorry to hear you're feeling this way. Can you tell me a little more about what's been going on that has you feeling this way?"}

Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
Give feedback to the Helper's last response.

### Input:
Seeker: Thank you!. this made me feel less stressed
Helper: You are always welcome!
Seeker: have a good night!
Helper: that's good, you have to eliminate your stress because it rest to your energy and good vibes
Seeker: I'm going to get some rest
Helper: study a lot please! don't give up.

### Response:{"perfect": false, "goodareas": [], "feedback": "The goal is to respond to the seeker's statement appropriately. It would be better to acknowledge their statement about getting some rest instead of shifting the focus to studying.", "badareas": ["Reflections", "Empathy"], "alternative": "That sounds like a great idea, getting some rest can really help. Good luck and good night!"}

Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
Give feedback to the Helper's last response.

### Input:
Seeker: My company cut my salary and I am scare of losing my job
Helper: Oh no, I am so sorry to hear that. So it sounds a bit like you are entering a period of uncertainty and are going to be struggling :(
Seeker: You are very correct, even now my job is one day off one day on
Helper: Well i know it is difficult, but just wanted to share that I am here for you in these hard times. And you're so smart that even if you lose this job you will find another one :). Actually currently I am unemployed too actually, although I have a new opportunity starting next month. So I know it can be rough
Seeker: I am happy for you friend, I pray for my company not to sack us because it is not easy t fine job now
Helper: Well have you thought of any next steps to take? From what I have seen, it is easier to start looking for a new job before you need to leave the old one. Maybe you could start job searching sooner rather than later? I might have some contacts that can help
Seeker: Thanks friend I love your style I follow it too
Helper: Awesome! Let me know if there is anything else I can do to help you in these tough times. It can be useful to take some time to relax too :) Maybe eat a favorite food or talk with a friend or go on a long walk to destress :)
Seeker: I will try to go and meditate on you teach me now thanks
Helper: It's completely normal to feel overwhelmed in situations like this and you're doing a great job taking steps to manage your stress. Remember, it's okay to lean on your support system when you need to. Are there any other concerns or thoughts you'd like to discuss?

### Response:{"perfect": true, "goodareas": ["Reflections", "Empathy", "Validation", "Questions"]}

Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
Give feedback to the Helper's last response.

### Input:
Seeker: I am not sure about that I feel ashamed a lot too about the way I feel
Helper: You are going through a lot, but you are stronger than you feel, I know you can get through this. Things will get easier.
Seeker: I don't think people should feel the way I do and I don't understand my feelings either
Helper: It sounds like you're struggling to understand your feelings, which can be very confusing and difficult. Can you tell me more about what you're experiencing?

### Response:{"perfect": true, "goodareas": ["Questions"]}

Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
Give feedback to the Helper's last response.

### Input:
Seeker: I am having trouble with depression lately after I had a sister pass away a few months ago in an unexpected fire.
Helper: Oh no, i am sorry to hear that. It must be devastating for you
Seeker: Yes, it has been extremely hard.
Helper: How are you feeling now?
Seeker: I am feeling extremely sad and like I don't feel like doing anything.
Helper: Have you seek therapy? Even if they can't lessen the pain, at least you have a place to vent out
Seeker: I have not for this particular issue, I tried it in the past and didn't like it too much.
Helper: I understand that therapy didn't seem to work for you in the past. How do you feel about trying other forms of support, like talking to friends or joining a support group?

### Response:{"perfect": true, "goodareas": ["Questions"]}

Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
Give feedback to the Helper's last response.

### Input:
Seeker: I broke up with my boyfriend because he cheated on me.
Helper: I hear you saying that your boyfriend broke up with you. Is that correct
Seeker: Yes, that's correct. I'm heartbroken!. Wait, no. I broke up with my boyfriend. he didn't break up with me
Helper: I am sorry to hear that. Can you tell me what led to the breakup
Seeker: I caught him cheating on me with my best friend. They were together at the movies and I caught them
Helper: Ok, that sounds like a terrible thing. Just know that it is not your fault that this happen. It is not a reflection on you.
Seeker: Are you sure? Because I keep wondering what I did wrong for him to cheat
Helper: You did nothing wrong, when people cheat it is their own issue they must deal with. You must be feeling horrible,but know that it will be ok, there is someone who will treat you with more respect
Seeker: I appreciate you saying that. It makes me feel a bit better! Do you have any advice about how I can take my mind off of things?
Helper: Do not let this affect your self esteem, as you are a valuable person. Take long walks, spend time enjoying your own company and know that you are worth it. You can also try spending time just talking to others as just friends but not getting emotionally involved.
Seeker: Taking a long walk is great advice. Perhaps I will try doing that more often. The fresh air always does me good. I have a lot of friends I can talk to about this but unfortunately COVID makes it difficult to see them.
Helper: I'm glad to hear you find the idea of walking helpful. It can be a good way to clear your mind and gain some perspective.

### Response:{"perfect": true, "goodareas": ["Reflections", "Validation", "Empathy"]}

Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
Give feedback to the Helper's last response.

### Input:
Seeker: I don't even know how to describe how I feel to people sometimes. I hope they will be coming soon when my youngest son gets out of school
Helper: It sounds like you are feeling overwhelmed right now.
Seeker: My mood seems to go up and down but mostly stays down I don't like going anywhere
Helper: You've mentioned your specialist and your kids. Is there anyone else in your life who you feel comfortable sharing your feelings with?

### Response:{"perfect": true, "goodareas": ["Questions"]}

Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
Give feedback to the Helper's last response.

### Input:
Seeker: I feel that the stress is effecting my sleep and my work, because I constantly worry. Any tips?
Helper: I would try to have a regular to set a goal for each day by stating to yourself today is a new day, remain focus on the task at hand, try not to worry about all tasks at once, and lastly try to find a relaxing sleep schedule that fits your needs.
Seeker: I see, I think making a schedule and breaking task into little ones will help complete them. I guess I will stress less.
Helper: Yes, It will be hard at first because you are not use to it, but once you get started your life will be so much more relaxing. Your stress level will become more less than what is was before. Also, You will be able to have a clearer mind to concentrate on your schoolwork more by having this new schedule.
Seeker: These message is really helpful and I will start doing what you have told me as soon as possible. I just want to live happily but thank you for this conversation.
Helper: I am glad to hear because you can do it. I believe in you. I am happy that this really help you and you are so very welcome.
Seeker: Thanks for the distressing tips and other tips as well, I wish a happy holiday. I do feel a lot better.
Helper: I wish you a great school semester because you deserve it. I am glad you feel better and continue keep this motivation about yourself to bring out the best you can be. Never settle less. You are so welcome, and I wish you a Happy Holiday as well.

### Response:{"perfect": false, "goodareas": ["Empathy"], "feedback": "The goal is to provide a positive farewell, but it could be improved by being more specific and clear. It would be great to be more concise and avoid using phrases that may be vague or unclear.", "badareas": ["Professionalism", "Structure"], "alternative": "I'm glad you're feeling better, and I'm confident you'll do great this next semester with the motivation you've shown. Remember, it's okay to take one step at a time. Happy holidays to you too!"}

Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
Give feedback to the Helper's last response.

### Input:
Seeker: I was doing okay in school, but when we had go virtual, I lost all my friends. I want to quit school and just go home. But my parents would not be happy.
Helper: why do you think so?
Seeker: I don't see anyone but my roommate and she has a boyfriend. I'm so lonely!
Helper: It's really difficult to feel alone. I'm sorry you're going through that.

### Response:{"perfect": true, "goodareas": ["Empathy", "Validation"]}

Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
Give feedback to the Helper's last response.

### Input:
Helper: Hey, how are you today?
Seeker: Hello! I am doing ok today. Just getting through the day I suppose.
Helper: It sounds like you're having a rough day. Anything in particular happened?
Seeker: Just an average day if I had to describe it. Nothing particularly unusual or bad. Worked for about 8 hours and now no plans for the night
Helper: I understand, it seems like you're having one of those 'ok' days. Do you usually find yourself without plans in the evening?

### Response:{"perfect": true, "goodareas": ["Reflections", "Validation", "Empathy"]}

Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
Give feedback to the Helper's last response.

### Input:
Seeker: yes, definitely
Helper: I had a lot of anxiety before exams when I was in school, too.
Seeker: how did you manage stress
Helper: I tried my best to get more sleep and I studied earlier so that I didn't panic at the last minute. That made it slightly less stressful.
Seeker: that is what I try to do, I also exercise to relieve the stress. the sleep part can be difficult
Helper: That is great! Exercise is supposed to help a lot with stress and anxiety.

### Response:{"perfect": false, "goodareas": ["Validation"], "feedback": "The goal is to continue to explore the barriers and challenges that the seeker is experiencing. It would be better to follow up the validation with a question to explore the difficulties with sleep.", "badareas": ["Questions"], "alternative": "That's great! Exercise can really help with stress and anxiety. What do you think is making the sleep part so difficult for you?"}

Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
Give feedback to the Helper's last response.

### Input:
Seeker: I feel like I am complaining to people too and that bothers me too because I am not
Helper: Whereabouts do you live?
Seeker: I live in southern Tennessee
Helper: It takes a lot of courage to be honest about your feelings. Remember, it's okay to express how you're feeling. You're not complaining, you're simply sharing your experiences.

### Response:{"perfect": true, "goodareas": ["Reflections", "Validation"]}

Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
Give feedback to the Helper's last response.

### Input:
Seeker: Hi
Helper: Hello, how are you doing?
Seeker: Feeling anxious these days
Helper: Those can be really hard feelings to deal with, but reaching out and acknowledging them is a very positive step. Is their anything in particular making you feel anxious?
Seeker: Yes. I dropped out of graduate school. Now, I need to get a job, but I'm having difficulty finding jobs for my degrees. And it's just stressful and depressig
Helper: Drastic changes in our life plans can feel very upsetting and looking for a job in these times is ridiculous.
Seeker: Yes, it really is
Helper: It sounds like you're going through a lot right now. Would you mind sharing what led to you deciding to leave graduate school?

### Response:{"perfect": true, "goodareas": ["Questions"]}

Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
Give feedback to the Helper's last response.

### Input:
Helper: Hi! What seems to be the issue?
Seeker: I'm depressed...
Helper: When did this start?
Seeker: Since as long as I can remember. I've always been depressed.
Helper: That sounds really hard. Depression is tough to manage.
Seeker: I know. It feels like I've tried everything but nothing works.
Helper: I can feel that you have a lot of pent up frustration with this, especially after trying so hard.
Seeker: Yes. I used to be angry but the anger has become sadness...
Helper: Lot of research shows that feelings of anger can morph into depression, that is not uncommon.
Seeker: I never knew that. When I was young, I was very angry but I held it inside.
Helper: I can tell that this has been very hard for you, especially since it has gone on so long.
Seeker: Yes, it has. I'm still hoping that there is a cure.
Helper: Why do you think you were angry?
Seeker: My parents got divorced and it ruined my childhood.
Helper: It sounds like your parents' divorce has had a long-lasting impact on you. Can you share more about how it affected you and how you've been dealing with it?

### Response:{"perfect": true, "goodareas": ["Self-disclosure", "Empathy"]}

Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
Give feedback to the Helper's last response.

### Input:
Seeker: Hi and good afternoon. Thank you for your time
Helper: Hello, and good afternoon yourself. How are you?
Seeker: Doing pretty good. Struggling a little
Helper: What is making you struggle?
Seeker: My situation involves our Daughter and Son-in-Law. He is not treating her well, rude, gaslighting and treating the dog better. He is also not very nice to our grandaughter. This is confidential, Right?
Helper: Yes, of course it is :). So we are talking about your daughter and her husband and their child together, right?
Seeker: Yes, He is a nice guy to others. At home he is so different.
Helper: I understand, people can often show different sides depending on who is around. Do you have any reason to think your daughter or granddaughter are in physical danger?

### Response:{"perfect": true, "goodareas": ["Empathy", "Questions"]}
